newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch confirm Schiphol night ban, more action due.
newsitem.headline: Dutch confirm Schiphol night ban, more action due.

text.p: The Dutch government confirmed a proposed night-time takeoff ban on noisy wide-body aircraft will take effect from tomorrow August 5.
The ban put forward by Schiphol airport had originally been due to take effect from August 1 but was delayed due to strong criticism from airlines and airfreight interests at the airport.
Additionally the government has now asked Schiphol to produce by September 1 an even tougher plan to keep noise levels within legal limits, the transport ministry said on Monday.
If the new plan was not adequate, transport minister Annemarie Jorritsma would consider sanctions which could include shutting all or part of the airport, the ministry said.

The first ban affects night-time take-offs of most wide-body aircraft -- such as McDonnell Douglas DC 10s and Boeing 747 100s, 200s and 300s and the Boeing 747SP -- from tomorrow and will operate between 2300 and 0600 (2100 to 0400 GMT).
A spokeswoman at Schiphol airport said they were aware of the Dutch government's objections to the current plan, but said it was too early to comment.
Dutch carrier KLM, Schiphol's biggest user, said last week the current restrictions were too stringent and could be relaxed without breaking legal noise limits.
